adjectives.description: termagant (comparative more termagant, superlative most termagant)

entries.meaning: Quarrelsome and scolding or censorious; shrewish.
A quarrelsome, scolding woman, especially one who is old and shrewish.
examples: [...] Make feeble ladies, in their works, / To fight like termagants and Turks; [...]

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A boisterous, brawling, turbulent person, whether male or female.
examples: At first the General tried to impose silence upon the terrible termagant: but he soon discovered that he was powerless
